mdRecord.dcterms:title: George Washington's Memorandum on planting and transplanting various types of trees & bushes
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Notes on best methods of planting and transplanting various kinds of trees and bushes, including a notation of the agricultural authority, Langley or Miller, from whom he got information. Also a notation on walks -- should be of gravel or Sand and winding and private -- the sides should be lined with Honey suckles -- sweetbrier-, and many other flowering shrubs. Autograph document, 4 pages, in George Washington's hand, laminated, watermark (Taylor).
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
Gardening
